web_search_results.title: Pitcher
key_points: The pitcher is a key player in baseball, responsible for throwing the ball to the batter.
Pitchers can be categorized into various types, including starting pitchers, relief pitchers, and closers.
The National League adopted the designated hitter rule in 2022, which affects the batting responsibilities of pitchers.
Pitching involves two main positions: the windup and the set position, each with specific procedures.
Pitchers use a variety of pitches, including fastballs, sliders, and curveballs, to outsmart batters.
Injuries are common among pitchers due to the physical demands of the role, leading to strategies like rotation and specialization.
Biomechanics of pitching are critical, with studies showing high stress on the arm, necessitating injury prevention strategies.

web_search_results.title: Pitch (card game)
key_points: Pitch is a trick-taking card game popular in the UK and the US, with origins tracing back to 'blind all fours'.
The game typically involves 2 to 9 players using a 54-card French deck, with a ranking of cards from Ace (highest) to 2 (lowest).
Pitch includes a bidding phase where players bid points they aim to win, with scoring based on high, low, jack, and game points.
Variations of the game include auction pitch, where the highest bidder establishes the trump suit and must meet their bid or face penalties.
Common scoring points include 1 point for high card, low card, jack of trumps, and the game point for the most pips won.
Partnership versions exist, typically played to a higher score like 21 points, with additional rules for shooting the moon.
Numerous game variants exist, including rules for jokers, off-jacks, and unique bidding strategies.

web_search_results.title: Hidden Injuries Might Be Affecting Ultimate Team in FIFA 23
key_points: Players in FIFA 23 Ultimate Team may have hidden, permanent injuries affecting performance.
A Twitter user discovered that injury statuses are visible only through the FIFA Companion App.
Injuries can be resolved temporarily with Injury Recovery cards, but the permanent status may remain.
Many players have reported similar findings, suggesting this could be a widespread issue.
There has been no official confirmation from EA regarding the hidden injuries.

web_search_results.title: NIAMS Health Information on Sports Injuries
key_points: Sports injuries affect both athletes and active individuals, often categorized as acute or chronic.
Acute injuries occur suddenly (e.g., sprains, fractures), while chronic injuries develop gradually due to overuse (e.g., tendinitis, shin splints).
Common treatment methods include R-I-C-E (rest, ice, compression, elevation) for minor injuries, and physical therapy or surgery for more severe cases.
Risk factors for sports injuries include improper techniques, overtraining, lack of proper equipment, and previous injuries.
Musculoskeletal injuries include fractures, dislocations, sprains, strains, tendinitis, and bursitis, often affecting joints like shoulders, elbows, knees, and ankles.
Symptoms of acute injuries include severe pain and swelling, while chronic injuries may cause pain during activity and dull aches at rest.
Most physical activity is safe, and the health benefits outweigh the risks associated with sports injuries.
